definition: to be at a loss for words/speechless
to tell to
dialect/language/speech
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
strategic pass/tactical border position
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with

sentences.english: I'm serious. I avoided her question.
sentences.chinese: 我语塞，支支吾吾地回避了她的问题。

sentences.english: The sight of his former wife dumbed the words in his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他一看见他的前妻，顿时感到语塞，说不出话来。

sentences.english: Their opponents were shut up by their argument.
sentences.chinese: 他们的争论使对手为之语塞。

sentences.english: Shocked and scared, I could not conjure up the courage to speak.
sentences.chinese: 又惊又怕的我竟一时语塞，没有勇气开口说话。

sentences.english: The given reason seemed very rational, which made my wife's tongue tied.
sentences.chinese: 这理由似乎很充分，老婆一时语塞。

definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to be left speechless/unable to respond
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
(of speech) indistinct/mumbling/hesitating
to rebuke/to reprimand
to respond evasively or vaguely/to elude/to stall
to resist/to deal with
to stammer/to mumble/to speak haltingly
to astonish/startled
stunned/amazed
stammering (idiom)
stammeringly
to stump sb with a question
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
embarrassed
to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
